intro: Mitracarpus frigidus var. portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican rock nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
